alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hunterdon, southwestern Morris, southwestern Sussex, Warren, northwestern Somerset, northwestern Bucks and eastern Northampton Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Blairstown to Pleasant Valley to Revere. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Newton, Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Washington, Blairstown, Mount Arlington, Flemington, High Bridge, Stanhope, Netcong, Clinton, Belvidere, Harmony, Peapack And Gladstone, Oxford, Alpha, Hope, Glen Gardner and Chester. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 75 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 27. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
